election_record.label: Virginia 1801 Governor

overview.note: "Washington City, December 18...On the 10th instant, James Munroe was again elected governor of Virginia, for the ensuing year. He lost but 3 votes." The Palladium: A Literary and Political Weekly Repository (Frankfort, KY). January 8, 1802

"On the 10th instant, James Munroe was again elected Governor of Virginia for the ensueing year. He lost but three votes." The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). December 23, 1801.

election_record.reference: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). December 23, 1801.
The Intelligencer, and Weekly Advertiser (Lancaster, PA). December 30, 1801.
The Palladium: A Literary and Political Weekly Repository (Frankfort, KY). January 8, 1802.
The Louisville Gazette; and Republican Trumpet (Louisville, GA). January 13, 1802.
